TEXT: The applicants are relatives . They are all NORP nationals and live in PERSON . Their particulars appear in the appendix . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Mr PERSON is the father of Mr PERSON , PERSON Konečníková and ORG . He is the husband of ORG . He operates a small entertainment park . It consists of merrygorounds and other attractions which are attached to movable trailers . The trailers have no number plates .

On DATE TIME , Mr PERSON , accompanied by PERSON , drove a tractor from the village of PERSON towing CARDINAL trailer . They stopped in front of a school in Leopoldov . Ms GPE got off the tractor and went to connect a second trailer to the convoy . A police car stopped nearby and an officer of ORG ( ORG oddelenie ORG zboru ) , PERSON , checked Mr PERSON identity card and driving licence . He inquired as to why the trailers had no number plates and then left . According to the applicants Officer PERSON shouted that he would impose a fine on Mr PERSON because “ he had an impudent [ sister ] ” and instructed them using harsh words to move on . The Government disagree on that point .

On DATE at TIME , Mr PERSON , accompanied by PERSON , again drove the tractor from PERSON towing a trailer . As they were entering the street where they lived , they noticed that a police car was behind them . They drove into the yard and stopped . The trailer protruded into the street . While PERSON was parking the tractor , a police officer from ORG , PERSON , entered the property without being invited , inquired of PERSON as to why the trailer had no number plates and asked him to produce his identity and driving documentation . Mr PERSON refused , arguing that he was on his private property . According to the applicants Officer PERSON shouted at Mr PERSON , shone an electric torch in his face and slapped him on his hand . The Government contest that suggestion . Mr PERSON then shouted to Mr PERSON for help . Officer PERSON subsequently left . During the entire incident the police car had been parked away from the scene . Officer PERSON , who was also present , remained close to the car .

On DATE , after TIME , PERSON called the police emergency service to report that his children had been attacked by Officers PERSON that evening the aforementioned officers also called the police emergency service to report the incident . They subsequently filed a report regarding the incident , which resulted in proceedings for roadtraffic offences being brought against Mr PERSON ( see below ) .

PERSON lodged numerous complaints with various public institutions about the incidents of DATE . He complained in particular that the police interventions had been unwarranted and arbitrary , that they constituted a discriminatory persecution of his family and that the subsequent investigation in respect of them was biased and ineffective . The investigation case file had been tampered with , the bodies which had examined his complaints had not been independent and impartial and the complaints were dismissed solely on the basis of the onesided information and reports submitted by the officers against whom the complaints had been directed . The applicants had not been given an opportunity to comment on the information and reports and in general had been treated in a discriminatory manner on account of their GPE origin . Lastly , PERSON argued that his trailers were exempt from the obligation to have number plates .

The above complaints were interpreted as administrative complaints ( sťažnosť ) under LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . ) . They were examined and dismissed by ORG ( PERSON riaditeľstvo policajného zboru ) and , on repeated appeals , by ORG ( Prezídium Policajného zboru ) and ORG ( ORG kontroly a inšpekčnej služby ministerstva vnútra ) . PERSON was informed of the dismissals by letters of DATE and DATE and DATE , respectively .

The authorities examined documentary evidence and statements from Mr PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , Officers S. and P. and several other police officers . The applicant ’s allegations were found not to be established . Their complaints were thus unfounded .
The procedure and its outcome were then examined and upheld as correct by ORG , ORG and ORG on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE respectively .

In the meantime , on DATE , ORG acknowledged that the trailers of PERSON were exempt from the duty to have number plates . It was further found that no records were missing from the case file of the investigation .
Further complaints of PERSON were dismissed by ORG on DATE , DATE and DATE and by ORG DATE respectively . The ORG allegations were found not to be substantiated .

On DATE ORG decided under LAW not to bring charges of abuse of official power against the officers involved in the incidents of CARDINAL and DATE and the alleged disappearance of documents from the case file . The examination of the files and evidence from the applicants and the officers revealed that there was no case to answer . The decision could have been , but was not , appealed .

On DATE the ORG ( ORG inšpektorát ) found that Mr PERSON had committed a traffic offence on DATE , having driven his tractor recklessly such that he could not be overtaken by a police car . The rear lights on his trailer were not functioning either . A fine of QUANTITY was imposed on him .

On DATE ORG upheld the decision on appeal by PERSON The decision could have been , but was not , challenged by an administrative - law action under LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . , as amended ) in conjunction with Articles CARDINAL et seq . of ORG ( Law no . PERSON . , as amended ) .
On DATE Mr PERSON was charged with insulting a public official , Officer PERSON , on DATE , by using grossly abusive language towards him .

On DATE ORG Okresný súd ) found Mr PERSON guilty as charged and sentenced him to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended for a period of one year . ORG examined documentary evidence and heard the accused , PERSON and Officers S. and P. It “ found no reasons not to believe ” the testimonies of the latter , notwithstanding that officer PERSON had not been directly involved in the incident , his recollection of the incident was vague and his testimony at the trial had differed from his pretrial deposition .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON súd ) dismissed the appeal by Mr Baláž Jr. No further appeal was available .
On DATE and DATE PERSON reported to the police that , on DATE , she had received from an unknown person threatening , racially motivated phone calls and text messages .

The matter was investigated by the PERSON and ORG which interviewed PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and CARDINAL other persons as witnesses . The police also obtained and examined CARDINAL reports from the telephone network operators . They established that the perpetrator of the threats was a classmate of Ms Konečníková Jr. The matter was considered to be a minor offence and the case was transmitted to ORG for the initiation of proceedings under LAW .

On DATE ORG found the classmate guilty of a minor offence and sentenced him to a reprimand ( pokarhanie ) . It was observed that the wrongdoer was a minor and that he had not meant his threats to be taken seriously .
